metadata.Title: CVE-2019-20907 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In Lib/tarfile.py in Python through 3.8.3, an attacker is able to craft a TAR archive leading to an infinite loop when opened by tarfile.open, because _proc_pax lacks header validation.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-20907` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python2.7 - 2.7.18-1~20.04.1
libpython2.7 - 2.7.18-1~20.04.1
libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.18-1~20.04.1
libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.18-1~20.04.1
libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.18-1~20.04.1
python2.7 - 2.7.18-1~20.04.1
python2.7-examples - 2.7.18-1~20.04.1
python2.7-minimal - 2.7.18-1~20.04.1
No subscription required

idle-python3.8 - 3.8.2-1ubuntu1.2
libpython3.8 - 3.8.2-1ubuntu1.2
libpython3.8-minimal - 3.8.2-1ubuntu1.2
libpython3.8-stdlib - 3.8.2-1ubuntu1.2
libpython3.8-testsuite - 3.8.2-1ubuntu1.2
python3.8 - 3.8.2-1ubuntu1.2
python3.8-examples - 3.8.2-1ubuntu1.2
python3.8-minimal - 3.8.2-1ubuntu1.2
python3.8-venv - 3.8.2-1ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.7.18-1~20.04.1').
python3.8 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.8.2-1ubuntu1.2').
